title: 5 Things to do in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam
excerpt: Ho Chi Minh is the capital city of Vietnam, there are a lot of things you can do here but you can squeeze your time and do amazing things in just few days!
content:
5 Things to do in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

Ho Chi Minh is the capital city of Vietnam, there are a lot of things you can do here but you can squeeze your time and do amazing things in just few days!

Travelling¬†to Vietnam was a big challenge for me since this was the very first time I travelled solo. I was excited when I got my plans sorted out already beforehand, but then again¬†I was having doubts to proceed with the tour for the reason of being scared on what may happen to me being alone. On the night before my flight, I was on the verge of backing out completely because I was afraid of doing something for the first time. But I know deep inside myself that I need to do this. So the day came and the next thing I knew I was on my way to Vietnam for my first solo travel.

Spending just few days in Saigon, I experienced a lot of things and was very glad I did it. This was definitely one thing that made me came out of my comfort zone, and a first from crazy experience to more!

Here are things you can do if you only have few days

1. Eat local food

One of the best thing in Vietnam is you can find good food anywhere you go! I was really looking forward for the food here and it was one of the main reason why I want to come¬†here. Local food is the best! It’s tasty and cheap!

Eat a lot of Pho. This is actually the best Pho I had because nothing beats the local! I was a bit lost somewhere in Saigon where I can’t find any restaurant with English menu. As I was walking wondering where to go, I saw this woman making broth of Pho literally in a corner of a street and a lot of people were¬†eating in just small tables and chairs. I knew from that moment that the¬†food is good‚Äìso I quickly went to her and ordered Pho, I was speaking to her in English but¬†she can’t seem to understand me, good thing someone overheard us¬†and translated my order to the lady. People here rock!

Don’t forget to try the vietnamese coffee! They use condensed milk instead of the natural milk, and their freshly brewed coffee is amazing! Make it an ice coffee for the hot weather!

2. Cu chi tunnel tour

This is one of the popular tours you can do in Saigon. During WWII, Vietnamese soldiers¬†use this little hole as a hiding spot for enemies.

You think you can fit into that?

Just look how small it is and how a person can fit into it! Crazy, I know. It’s interesting that you learn about these things happened¬†in the past especially during the time of war, you’ll see how creative people become for setting traps and stuff. Kinda scary if you ask me and fascinating at the same time!

3. Mekong delta tour

This is another famous tour you can do here. I got a¬†deal for this tour in the hostel I was staying at and they had¬†a very good deal. Cheaper than the people offering outside the streets. I got the 2 days tour which includes an overnight home stay and I was looking forward to that to experience a night with the locals.¬†

Mekong river is one of the longest river in the world, you can get to different countries through this.¬†The explanation to us why this river is color brown was because it carries too much silt, that brings additional nutrients and thus, fruits that grow within the area absorbs it and produces sweet taste!

This lunch was included in the tour, except for that big fish which you can buy and I recommend that you do so if ever you’ll be doing it by tour (I think all tour has one main spot where they take the group for lunch). The food was alright, I was more excited with that fish which they catch it live from the river, fry them and serve it. So the best way to eat it is make it as a vietnamese roll and dip it in their amazing sauce! I got to talk to the people I’m in the table with, share some stories while we eat this fantastic lunch.

Mekong delta tour homestay included – So after the whole day tour, the guide gave us instructions on how we are going to a local place for our homestay.

The locals taught us how to do/cook some local food like frying spring rolls. After that we had our dinner, which was so amazing! The feeling was great! Sharing a plate with people who you just met and local people there, and all of just were just sharing stories and laughter. The next day, I get to go around the village by riding a bike since we have a time to spare.

4. Visit the war museum

Check out¬†some vietnamese history!

This museum represents how people fought for their country‚Äìwhy it even started, weapons they’ve used, or the tragedy they suffered. It’s depressing reading stories of people’s experiences during the war‚Äìhow people was being treated, they have nothing to eat for days, or just the war itself.

 

5. Night life

Ho Chi Minh is also famous for its night life! Especially on the busy streets where you can find a lot of foreigners drinking and partying. How can you go wrong with a cheap beer and the chance to socialise with people from all over the world? I tell you, prepare to have a crazy night!

Just be careful, some nights can be crazy as hell and you don’t want yourself having troubles.

Explore night markets, there are a lot of things happening here‚Äìfrom cheap stuffs to¬†great food choices! Just make sure you have a big appetite coming beforehand¬†because you’re definitely going to try a lot of street food!

image.alt: 5 Things to do in Ho Chi Minh City, Vietnam

title: First Skydiving Experience
excerpt: I want to do something daring and what could it possibly be other than the adrenaline rush and heart-stopping skydiving
content:
First Skydiving Experience

After doing the highest bungee jump in the world in Macau, I want to do something more daring and what could it possibly be other than the adrenaline rush and heart-stopping skydiving!!!!!¬†It was one of the highlights of my tour that time.

For the whole video, click this

I chose Tandem Cairns¬†for my first Skydiving. This was the cheapest with good reviews based on my research and I booked this before going to Cairns, so there’s no turning back!

And so the day came and I was ready for it. Bring it on!

We went to the skydiving site, registered and gave us instructions. I’m on the last batch and have to wait for the first batches to finish first.

I noticed there are two batches of skydiving instructors, they take turns every flight. So when it’s my turn, I guess my instructor was already tired. I just hope he doesn’t forget to pull out the parachute in time! Haha.

Waiting time…

the worst feeling I had. Just thinking whether you’ll still be alive after this or not. Haha just kidding.

After waiting for few hours, it’s now our turn to skydive! I’m so excited and a bit nervous.

They first interview me for the video compilation purposes..

On my way to the plane..

This is what it looks like inside the plane..

This is my partner, he’s in charge of my life at this time.

I was already feeling a bit nervous this time. I can already see that we’re already high above the ground.

I can already see clouds. Oh my, I’m about to piss my pants off!

My instructor told me that we’re only half way through. I just laughed off the nervous feeling building inside me.

Okay, they’re telling us to get ready because we’re almost there. I now got my serious trying not to piss or shit my pants off face.

At this time, If I remember it correctly,¬†I was about to tell my instructor that I’m backing off, but then I thought I will look like a fool if I did. So what the hell, let’s do this!

There comes the first diver. OMG the transition was like only 5 seconds¬†for the next one to go after.
Alright, We’ll be the third one to jump. I’m ready!

The Dive

And it all comes to this.. I can’t feel anything by this time. Just my heartbeat pumping really hard.

And there we go..

For few seconds, my heart stopped.

How awesome is that!

After around 45 seconds of having adrenaline rush from the free fall, the parachute pops out..

I was supposed to land¬†at the beach side but there were no slots left for that jump. But hey, this view is still an awesome view!

The aftermath

After the skydive, I could not remember much of what happened¬†and¬†I had that adrenaline feeling vibrating through out my body for few minutes.

I was really happy doing this challenge for myself and for the extraordinary experience.

I’ll definitely¬†going to do this again!

title: 4D 3N Itinerary Phuket, Thailand
excerpt: Phuket is a small famous island in Thailand and known for its limestone caves, blue waters, beautiful sandy beaches, magnificent islands, food & night life.
content:
4D 3N Itinerary Phuket, Thailand

Phuket is a small famous island in Thailand and known for its limestone caves, blue waters, beautiful sandy beaches, magnificent islands, food & night life. It’s also packed with activities to do day and night! It’s like a 24/7 things to do! How are you going to enjoy these? Of course bring friends and do all crazy stuff! Me and my friends¬†spent 4 days and 3 nights in this island. But I tell you, it wasn’t enough! I suggest to stay long and explore more of Phuket.¬†Planning to go there? This itinerary might help you.

Day 1 –¬†Check in at hostel, roam around Bangla road & Patong beach

First stop! We rode¬†a taxi from the airport to our hostel which was about 45 mins drive and about 800 Baht. We did not had a hard time trying to find the hostel since it was in a good location and has instructions on how to get there from the airport.

We stayed in a Hostel, I prefer staying in a hostel when I travel to these kinds of places. Accommodation are way less cheaper than hotels. Location wise it’s good because it’s like 5mins walk away from the beach and the nightlife! Tours are cheaper compared to the agencies outside.

If you want to check the hostel we stayed at, you can check it here.
Price:¬†34 USD/night = 3 beds in 1 room
You can check the website for more details

This what the reception at the hostel looks like. Staff are nice and approachable, we even asked them what kind of tours are suitable with our schedule since we arrived in late and we want some activities the next morning. They were very helpful for setting us up in a tour on the last minute. Our stay was very pleasant, indeed!

We checked in when we arrived. I¬†booked¬†a room with three bed that will accommodate the 3 of us. It has its own bathroom inside but you can still use the shared bathroom outside in able for all of you to prepare at the same time.

Hostel has its own lounge for travelers to meet, chit-chat or relax. You can setup a movie in the lounge so you can watch movies during your free time, It has wifi of course, bean bags and foam mattress where you can lay down and relax. It’s also 5mins walk from the patong beach, night life. Eateries and massages everywhere.

We left our things and went out right away since it was already late and we’re starving. We will roam around the night life first and find something to eat after.

The famous patong beach! located in Bangla road. Phuket is also known for it’s nightlife. Among beaches in Phuket, Patong beach is the most popular one. People stay up and party all night! So if you’re into these kinds of stuff, just make sure that before you go, you get some sleep because you’re not getting one here!

Bangla Road is where the bars, clubs and party freaks are.

There’s also lots of locals trying to invite you and watch girls dancing in the pole in the nightclubs. You can do it just for the experience if you are curious too. Just make sure they are real women. Haha. Just walk around here and you can see a lot of people drinking, partying and socializing. Mixed races from different parts of the world.

After¬†roaming around and have checked all the eateries around we end up eating in a hawker centre near our hostel and Bangla road.
This is our first meal in Phuket. We had Tom yum soup, shrimp pad thai, vegetable rolls and down it with a local thai beer! We shared everything so we can try everything, except for the beer of course!

After dinner, we roam around bangla road again to see how it goes. It was pretty late so I think people are already drunk and no where to be found. We went to the beach, had few drinks and shared some stories. We felt a bit hungry, went back to the road and looked for food. There’s a lot of streetfoods around. Regarding the food, even though we were already that hungry, we didn’t find the food good. It has a different taste and maybe we are just not used to it like the locals do. But it’s still worth a try for the experience.

It was already around 4am when we finished. We went back to the hostel to get couple of hours sleep and be ready for the next day. Told you that you won’t be having any sleep here! Haha.

Day 2 – James Bond Island –¬†Khao Phing Kan in Phang Nga Bay

We woke up early because we need to book our tour since it was already very late when we arrived and was not possible to book any tour. Reception told us to come early and they can arrange things for us. We were supposed to do Phi Phi Island first but there were no available seats left for us. We asked the receptionist for recommendations and they said James Bond Island was a very good tour and has room that can accommodate us 3. We booked it and instructed us to come back after 45minutes because the tour guide will pick¬†us up at the hostel. My friends grabbed a quick bite,¬†I just had water since I’m not a breakfast person. Anyway, there will be snacks & coffee at the waiting area of the tour before heading to the Island itself.

We went back to the hostel and waited for the tour guide. After few minutes he arrived, we rode a van going to the port and took us around 45mins to reach it. There’s a waiting area near the port and we waited there for them to finalise all the people who are coming. They offered snacks & drinks while we wait. As soon as they are good to go they instructed us on where to go and from there, we walked.

We rode a big boat going there. The view was outstanding! You can feel the sea¬†breeze,¬†it’s cool and refreshing! Just sitting in front of the boat staring at those beautiful islands as you get closer and closer to them makes this trip amazing! As you pass by them you get to cherish how beautiful God’s creations are. Thinking about nothing and you can really feel you are on a vacation¬†and it’s very relaxing! This is how you enjoy these kinds of stuff!

The water is nice and clear, we passed by small islands (which are¬†made of limestones. Sadly,¬†some of them went¬†bad and were destroyed). We made a stop over here to do some activities I guess. Well, good thing I am using a rash guard because the sun is up!

Our first activity was Canoeing and there will be someone who would row it, too bad we want to try rowing ourselves. Max of 4 per boat including the paddler.¬†Anyway, more time for us to take videos and photos! We went through this bat cave to see natural limestones. The space on some areas are tight and you need to lower down your head so watch out for those ones! Our rower, who I forgot the name, was very entertaining. He shared some stories and talked about some culture and history of this place.

This shot by our rower was pretty good! He knows a good angle and I bet he do this for everyone he¬†has¬†been rowing with for.
Okay so we roam around these islands maybe for 2 hours¬†and we head back to the boat for lunch. Wooh the best time! We were already starving so it’s good time to eat.
We were on the first batch to get back so we quickly get some food before everyone arrives and we might fall in line. It’s buffet so you can be full from this meal. They also provide free drinks like water & softdrinks. They have beer but they are selling it though.

They have rice, seafood, chicken, pork and noodles. I wasn’t expecting the food to be this good! I really love it especially the fish and the fried kale! It was very delish! It’s very oily though, but who cares? we’re on a vacation and might as well eat all the things we can!¬†¬†The ambience is a plus. Eating good food with this kind of vibe and atmosphere is definitely a good experience!

It was already around 2 in the afternoon by the time we finished lunch. The tour guide then told us we are going to do a small side trip to a small village ¬†called Koh Panyee to see and experience how local people live here. Like what their homes look like and their culture.

This is what their typical household looks like. Just small and simple. You can see a lot of kids running around the village, people working and building boats or sewing local clothes. They also have areas here where they sell local food and souvenirs. Oh, they also have a mosque here. This is a muslim community so they will have somewhere to pray on.

James Bond Island

After a short tour around. We went to our final destination and take a closer look at James Bond Island. This is where the hit film James Bond shoot before and that’s why this island is very famous aside from being awesome. If you have watched the Man with the Golden Gun, this places will look familiar for you. The place is interesting. You can roam around the area, buy souvenirs or refreshing snacks like cold coconut, shakes, ice cream etc. We only spent here around 30minutes if I remember it correctly since we are going somewhere to do snorkeling before the trip ends.

We finished the tour around 4 in the afternoon. We were laughing because after we went to do snorkeling, we realized we didn’t brought any towel to wipe ourselves up. So we ended up being wet in the boat and the van going back to the port and our hostel. Travel time was around 45mins so we had a little rest but we were feeling cold because we did not get to dry up completely.

On our way to the hostel, we passed by food stalls and a hawker¬†centre, we thought of having dinner there since we saw a lot of tourists and even locals eating. So by the time we arrived at our hostel, we took a quick rest and had some beer in the lounge area because apparently one of our friend wants to take a nap first (weakling, haha)

Malin Plaza

Malin Plaza is 15mins walk away from the beach. But you could also ride a tuk-tuk.¬†We prefer walking to enjoy the local experience and get to see some stalls on the way there.

You get to choose from these fresh seafood, they have different kinds of fish, shrimp, prawns, squids, shells and even lobsters! Have them cook it and be back maybe within 15minutes or depends because some has a lot of orders and you might need to wait for longer time. But hey, it’s worth the wait! Anyway, you can roam around the area and check other food stalls while waiting. There are stalls selling noodles, chicken, duck, desserts like crepes and shakes. I recommend trying their fruit shake especially if the fruits are on season since it is very sweet and delish!

So we end up¬†ordering grilled pork ribs, fried duck and grilled stingray. Actually, this is our first time to try stingray. and for us, it is already an exotic food since we don’t get to see it being sold in the market where we came from. It was very good and interesting. We thought the texture will be some kind of rubbery based from its appearance, but hey the texture was similar to a fish. It’s very firm and tasty! We loved it! It’s a little bit bony though so watch out. The duck and grilled pork ribs was delish too! We had couple of beer to down this awesome¬†food!

After having dinner, we then roam around and went out for another night life, had some drinks, ate some food again(of course)¬†and¬†socialize with other people. We end up staying at the beach area again. It was more relaxing drinking there¬†with your friends, sharing stories and get to meet some fellow travellers as well.

At around 3 in the morning, we went back to the hostel and rest for the next day’s activities.

Day 3 – Phi Phi Island

We already booked the tour a day before because the receptionist told us this tour is always full since it’s the most popular one in Phuket. So, it has the same setup, someone will pick us up and will drop us off at the port. We did not had breakfast prior to this because the waiting area at the port will provide free snacks & drinks.
At the waiting area before getting on the boat, the tour guide briefed us on our itinerary for the day and asked us if we wanted to rent flippers to experience snorkeling better and because¬†some areas of it has sea urchins underneath and might stung us.

So, we are going to ride a big speed boat on this tour. You don’t get to see any view inside the speed boat unless you are in front where there is no shade and the sun is up and it’s really hot. We prefer to stay at the back instead. The boat was packed and all spaces are occupied.

Maya Bay

So this is our first stop, Maya bay. The reason why we had to go here first is because the way going to Phi Phi Island has bad waves and passengers might get sea sick and start puking all over the boat which is not the thing you want to happen¬†with this trip. A lot of tourists are here as well.

We are going to spend approximately 2 hours here before going to Phi Phi Island. The tour guide will provide free fresh watermelons and pineapple! Yum! Apparently, you need to pay in order for you to use the beach chairs. We rented out two¬†so we can put our things there.

You¬†get to¬†do some snorkeling, roam around in this small island, take a lot of photos or just relax sitting in a beach chair eating fresh fruits together with a cocktail or a beer!

Phi Phi Island

So after Maya Bay, we head to Phi Phi Island. It has two sides, and this is Phi Phi Leh. We spent 20 minutes here for picture taking or you can go swim in its clear waters.

 

After Phi Phi Leh, we went to Phi Phi Don, its other side and had our lunch there. it’s a no pork buffet since the place is a muslim community and they don’t eat pork. It’s fine so we can get to eat healthy food like salads during this trip. Haha. The food was not that good though compared to our lunch yesterday. But the fruits are sweet!

So it was already around 2pm by the time we finished eating lunch. We still had some minutes before we head back to the boat to do the last activity. We were so full and decided to lay down under the tree and just breathe fresh air. Watch out for some areas though since we saw a lot of dog poop so we made sure the place we are laying to is clean.

For our last activity, we went snorkeling at the monkey beach and it’s just¬†near the Phi Phi Island. There were monkeys in that beach(yes that’s why it’s called monkey beach).¬†One funny thing happened apparently, a fellow traveler touched a young¬†monkey and he was attacked by its parents then he ran out to the beach and swam. Haha. So never touch a monkey again!

We snorkel for maybe 30minutes. I’m glad we rented out flippers because there were a lot of sea urchins underneath! I also saw nemo(clown fish). What a fantastic experience!

It’s already past 4 in the afternoon by the time we finished the tour. We rested at the lounge area again and had couple of beers before going out to get dinner. We had dinner at Malin Plaza again and had fish & noodles since we not that hungry. After dinner, we roam around bangla road and end up going to the beach to have some drinks. We met some fellow travellers from different parts of the world. We shared stories, had drinks and games. It was a fun and memorable night! Those memories are what you will cherish forever in these kinds of trips.

So it’s already past 3 when we finished. We were very tired not having enough sleep¬†and doing a lot of activities. Anyway, our agenda for our last day is just go to the city, buy some souvenirs and eat at a local hawker centre.

Day 4 – Phuket¬†Town

So we woke up a bit late than usual. We head up to Phuket town, we actually got lost on our way because the receptionist didn’t understand us clearly and gave us wrong directions. Anyway, we just rode a cab going to town.

The town was pretty quiet. We were supposed to go to a hawker centre¬†to eat local food but it was closed and will be open at a later time. We then walked around and looked for food.¬†We found a local food stall. The menu is written in Thai. Good thing there were pictures posted around and that’s how we ordered.

Food was very good! I think this was the best meal we had during our stay. The drinks were also very good!

After buying souvenirs, we went back to Patong beach and roam around for the last time before our flight back. üôÇ

title: The 3 Best Tonkotsu Ramen to try in Fukuoka, Japan – Yatai, Ippudo, Ramen Street
excerpt: Some people consider this if not the best, definitely one of the best ramen there is
content:
Tonkotsu Ramen¬†aka “Hakata Ramen”

Tonkotsu¬†(“pork bone”)¬†ramen usually has a cloudy white colored broth. It has a thick broth made from boiling pork bones, fat, and collagen over high heat for many hours, which suffuses the broth with a hearty pork flavor and a creamy consistency that rivals milk.¬†The noodles are thin and straight, and it is often served with beni shoga (pickled ginger). In recent years the latest trend in tonkotsu toppings is mƒÅyu (sesame oil), a blackish, aromatic oil made from either charred crushed garlic or Sesame seeds.

Fukuoka in Japan is the home of the BEST¬†Tonkotsu¬†Ramen.. Like me, people travel here from even from different parts of the world¬†just to try this authentic ramen dish.

You can find this ramen everywhere. Although all of them are good, we’re still going to have favorites! and these are my top 3 ramen places I recommend¬†you must¬†try when you visit Fukuoka, Japan.

1. Yatai (Food Stall in Fukuoka Streets) – Located in Nakasu River

There are a lot of Yatai spread out across Fukuoka city, but the famous are found around Tenjin and Nakasu. It was even rated one of the top¬†street foods in Asia!

“Yatai are the outdoor food stalls that line Fukuoka‚Äôs streets, serving delicious food night after night before disappearing during the day time.”

People go here after work hours to have dinner or drinks with friends/colleagues.

Each stall has specialty and they sell different kinds of food like bbq, sushi, shabu-shabu. But it is also a famous place for local Tonkotsu Ramen.

Beside the stall you can check if they sell ramen or not, make sure to see the price first because some are really expensive and you might get shock when you’re about to pay the bill (like we did when we ordered BBQ)

All of them looks very good, just pick one based from¬†your instincts. They are all delicious anyway.

This guy is preparing our ramen. Yummmm!!

I added few pickled ginger and garlic to make it even more delicious!

 

 

2. Ippudo – 10F AMU Plaza Hakata (Located in Hakata Station)

Ippudo is a very famous ramen chain and has several branches all over the world.

Ippudo was first started in Fukuoka by Shigemi Kawahara, the CEO of Chikaranomoto Company. “Ippudo” in direct translation means “one wind hall”, and this is named because at the time, there were dark clouds over the Kyushu ramen industry, and the founder CEO Kawahara intended to “blow wind and revolutionise the era”.

Based from a lot of people who tasted Ippudo aside from Hakata Branch, they said Hakata Ippudo is way better than what they had. And I agree with that for sure!

¬†¬†

 

 

3. Ikkousha Ramen – 2F Deitos Ramen Street (Located in Hakata Station)

Actually, this ramen chain is number 1 in Indonesia and Singapore and it even won in a ramen championship in Singapore. After eating this, it’s no wonder how it became very popular. The broth is very rich, milky in a balance way where you can just eat and eat. For all ramen lovers out there, I’m very sure you’ll love this ramen.

Vending machine where you order your ramen from.

image.alt: The 3 Best Tonkotsu Ramen to try in Fukuoka, Japan – Yatai, Ippudo, Ramen Street

title: 1D Itinerary in Fukuoka, Japan – Nanzoin Temple, Yatai, Ippudo
excerpt: Some people consider this if not the best, definitely one of the best ramen there is
content:
1D Itinerary¬†in Fukuoka, Japan¬†– Nanzoin Temple, Yatai, Ippudo

Fukuoka (Á¶èÂ≤°Â∏ÇFukuoka-shi?) is the capital city of Fukuoka Prefecture and is situated on the northern shore of the island of Kyushu in Japan.¬†As of July 2011, Fukuoka is Japan’s sixth largest city, having passed the population of Kyoto.

Fukuoka was our first destination in Japan. The first reason why I like to visit Fukuoka was because of it’s authentic & specialty ¬†Tonkotsu Ramen. Some people consider this if not the best, definitely one of the best ramen there is. Although Fukuoka is not very popular destination in Japan comparing to¬†Osaka, Kyoto or Tokyo. It still does offer good tourist destinations. This is the home of the biggest reclining Buddha in the world and where the famous Ramen Chain, Ippudo, originated from.

Technically this itinerary is for 2 days but since we arrived at night time and will only spend¬†half day the next day, it’s possible to¬†count it just 1 day or less than 24hours. Yeah? üôÇ

Arriving at Fukuoka, Japan

Okay. So we arrive late maybe around 9¬†in the evening.. getting to your hotel from the airport is easy. Just go to the exit and you will see a taxi stand. Give them the address and you will be on your way. It is metered and people here are honest so you don’t have to worry about anything.

You can visit this or this for more details on how you can get to your destination coming off from the Fukuoka Airport.

Accommodation – Hana Hostel

We booked an accommodation in Hana Hostel. Why Hostel? because it is relatively cheaper¬†compared to hotels and we just need a place to stay and rest since we will get up early in the morning to go to Tokyo.

The reviews of Hana Hostel are¬†good and they’re located in the heart¬†of Hakata. Actually, they are in a shopping street so restos/shops are just around your corner so it’s very accessible and convenient. You can check more of our stay with prices, etc.¬†here.

Checking in is fast and all went smooth. And don’t worry about the communication, they speak english.

Their room is clean and tidy and has everything we need for our stay like comfy beds, A/C, thick blankets, hot shower and fast wifi.

*Photo was taken in the morning*

Dinner – Fukuoka Yatai in Nakasu River

Open:¬†6pm to around 2am – Daily

Okay, after we checked in we went to a famous Yatai (Nakasu River) that is close in our accommodation (that’s why I chose Hana Hostel).

We asked the lady in the reception of the Hostel for directions and we were on our way.¬†I think it was around 10 – 15min walk going there from the Hostel. You will pass by shops and restos on your way to the river since you are at the heart of Hakata. Many people are still out even on late nights especially in this area.

It’s not hard to find since it is just beside the river and you will see a lot of Yatai (Food Stall). If you¬†notice that many people(especially tourist looking ones) are walking towards the same direction, you may assume they are going to a Yatai.

I suggest to check all Yatai first so you will have a lot of options to choose from. All of them are good anyway but some are expensive than others. You might want to check the prices first so you won’t be shock when the bill comes.

You can check this blog¬†for our Yatai Experience and other ramen places in Fukuoka, Japan.

Following¬†day..

  • Nanzoin Temple in Sasaguri, Fukuoka, Japan
  • Lunch at Ippudo
  • Train – Shinkansen to Tokyo

Hakata Station – Largest and busiest station in Kyushu Region of Japan. It can be very busy in the station especially during rush¬†hours since a lot of people are coming from/to work. At your first time you might have a hard time finding your way, don’t worry because there is a concierge and you can ask them anything.

Subway, Train – Shinkansen, Buses, Mall, etc can be found here.

Nanzoin Temple

Access: From Hakata station, you can use Sasaguri Line and get out of¬†Kido Nanzoin-mae Station and travel time is around 25¬†minutes. At the station before you get out, you can ask for directions for the route going to Nanzoin Temple. They will give you a sketch and it’s easy to follow. Walking towards there is only around 10 mins.
Open: 9 am – 5 pm Daily

The world‚Äôs largest reclining bronze statue of Buddha in Nanzoin Temple

The reclining Buddha statue, known as either Nehanzo or Shaka Nehan (“Nirvana”) is 41 meters long, 11 meters high, and weighs nearly 300 tons. The statue depicts Buddha at the moment of death, or entrance into nirvana.

Lunch – Ippudo

Address: JR Hakata City 10-F AMU PLAZA HAKATA. It’s in the train station itself and just use elevator going to 10th floor.
Open:¬†11:00 – 22:00 Daily

We grabbed a bite first before heading to Tokyo. Of course, it’s¬†ramen! But this time, in Ippudo. It¬†is a very famous ramen resto chain and has branches all over the world. For Ippudo lovers, you can get the original authentic taste here in Fukuoka since this is where it originated. Nothing beats the original!

About 12 noon after having lunch. We are on our way to Tokyo by Shinkansen. Travel time is around 6 hours.

image.alt: 1D Itinerary in Fukuoka, Japan – Nanzoin Temple, Yatai, Ippudo

title: Itinerary in Osaka – Dotonbori, Osaka Castle, Shinsekai
excerpt: We just arrived in Osaka City.
content:
We just arrived in Osaka City.

On our way to our accommodation first to leave our luggages and rest first.

On our way to our place, we need to transfer stations and on the way to the other station we passed by this street mall where there are several restos and stalls selling different kinds of things.

Route map of Osaka. Looks complicated ay? at first yeah. but you just have to look for the train station and what line you need to get to and that will probably be fine.

Our accommodation. We booked in AirBNB. I suggest you book at AirBNB as well since they are very popular for accommodation in Japan. Very cheap and more convenient as per my experience comparing to staying at hotels. Please visit¬†Where to stay in Fukuoka, Osaka & Tokyo, Japan for guides & tips getting accommodation

Our host jsut gave us instructions on how to get to the apartment and it’s key.

Our toilet & shower were¬†clean and nice. However using the shower is a bit annoying for it takes several minutes for the water to heat up then it gets cold again. I talked to the¬†host about this issue but unfortunately, it was not resolved during our stay.

We just rested for few minutes then we were on our way to Dotonbori to eat and explore!

¬†¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†¬† ¬†¬†¬†¬†¬† ¬† ¬† ¬†

We wonder around Dotonbori and eat whatever food we see that looks good!
Kindly visit¬†Eat til you drop in Dotonbori, Osaka, Japan for more details¬†on things we did in Dotonbori.

Afterwards, we just went home and rest to be ready for the next day..

Day 2

We grab a bite first in the shopping mall on our way to the train station.

We can’t resist these good looking bread..¬†very good indeed!

We are on our way to Osaka Station..

Getting to Osaka Castle – From the station there are instructions and signs on how to go there. just follow it.

It might take you around 20mins¬†of walking to go on top.. don’t worry, it’s a good exercise!

This time capsule is pretty interesting, I wonder what happens when they open it years later?

There were several food stalls outside Osaka Castle for people who got hungry walking towards there. We did and we got Takoyaki. Yum!

Saw some Cherry Blossoms on the way back to train station from Osaka Castle. Soooooo beautiful!

¬†¬†¬†

After Osaka Castle, we had bread and coffee in the mall beside¬†Osaka train station before going home.

After resting, I decided to go out again. My mother was pretty tired and didn’t bother to come with me.

Osaka Shinsekai is close to our accommodation. Maybe around 20min walk? It was already night time when I got there and most of the shops were¬†already closed. but restos were still open. Time to get some foooood.

I’m wondering around this area and looking for a place to eat.. mmmm..

This resto has a lot of people eating inside so I’m assuming it’s good. Haha

Watched this guy make the fresh sushi in front of me. I was already drooling just watching him prepare it.

Look at thaaaat! Uni, Salmon Roe, Scallops, Salmon & Crab. What can go wrong with these???

I swear this is one of the best sushi I’ve eaten! I enjoyed every bite of it.

To cap off the night, I bought a beer and drank it on my way home. (yeah it’s allowed haha)

I went to Kyoto the next day. To read visit¬†Things to do in Kyoto, Japan

Other related blogs¬†in Japan
Itineraries:
Things to do in Tokyo, Japan¬†
Things to do in Fukuoka, Japan

Food:
Where to get ramen in Fukuoka, Japan
Eat til you drop in Dotonbori, Osaka, Japan

Accommodation:
Where to stay in Fukuoka, Osaka & Tokyo, Japan

image.alt: Itinerary in Osaka – Dotonbori, Osaka Castle, Shinsekai

title: Osaka Dotonbori – Non stop eating
excerpt: Dotonbori is a famous shopping and food street in Osaka. A must when you go here!
content:
Dotonbori is a famous shopping and food street in Osaka. A must when you go here!

You will be needing the whole day & night to walk¬†around here and should be on an empty stomach to eat all the food you can!

It’s always packed with tourists all over the place. There are also famous areas here like the mechanical big crab & glico running man.

 

One of the area’s most prominent features, a billboard for confectionery company Glico displaying the image of a runner crossing a finishing line, is seen as an icon of Osaka within Japan.

Ooooohhhh! The famous Pablo cheesecake! I really felt happy when I saw this! It’s like I want to go there and eat all their cheesecake! Haha! Need to fall in a long line first though.

¬†¬†

You can choose the how it’s cook from either rare or medium. rare is a bit gooey – recommended!

This one can go for 6 hours before going off if not placed inside the fridge.

Definitely worth the wait! It was actually love at first bite! Haha

Saw this food truck has a long line so I fall in too. looks so good too!¬†

It’s a freshly baked bread cut in half and she puts ice cream inside it. really really really goood!

Japan’s famous food! Takoyaki and Gyoza. Actually the gyoza stall is Osaka Ohsho, a famous gyoza chain.

¬†

King crab aquarium. They are waiting to be selected and be eaten. Poor delicious king crabs.

Uncle Rikuro’s cheesecake – this is very popular as well. But I didn’t got the chance to try it. I was shopping at that time when I passed this stall and thought would just buy when I’m about to get home. Then when I came back they were already closed. too bad üôÅ looks really good though!

Okonomiyaki “Osaka Food Soul”¬† – Originated in Osaka and its most popular local food, a Japanese savoury pancake.

It’s like a crunchy donut with a belgian chocolate filling in it. very very good!

¬†

title: Where to stay in Japan – Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, Fukuoka
excerpt: Fukuoka City – Kyusu Region’s largest and busiest city. Home of the original Tonkotsu Ramen. Home of the largest Reclining Buddha in the world.
content:
*Note: These are only recommendations and are based only from my experience staying in these accommodations.

Fukuoka City – Kyusu Region’s largest and busiest city. Home of the original Tonkotsu Ramen. Home of the largest Reclining Buddha in the world.

Things to do here : links

Fukuoka Hana Hostel¬†– asked why I¬†chose¬†a Hostel? It has a lot of advantage over Hotels like value for money, cleanliness, local flavor, social interaction etc. But the main reason was Hotel is more expensive in Japan and it will cost us triple the price. We just need a place to stay for the night since we’re leaving early in the morning and the location is very convenient since we are going to Nakasu River to have dinner in Yatai (walking distance from the Hostel). I make sure to read¬†the reviews, feedbacks, the hostel’s facilities and their rules & guidelines first before making a reservation.

Price:¬† 1x night for 2 persons (currency convertion was made during the time we made the reservation)
PHP ¬†2,800
or USD ¬†59.5
or YEN ¬†6,094

Check-in¬†3pm ¬†& Check-out¬†11am
Location: 4-213, Kamikawabata-machi, Hakata-ku, Fukuoka City, Japan
Getting there: We just took a taxi we payed around 2,500 Yen from Fukuoka Airport. The taxi dropped us off in the nearest street since they can’t go inside the shopping street. from there it only took us 2min walk going to the Hostel. You can also ride a train and just walk 10 minutes from the station.

Where you can have a look for more details: Hana Hostel

Hana Hostel is located in the middle of a shopping street in CBD of Fukuoka so there is no problem getting dinner & shopping because it’s already there at the front of your door!

 

Tokyo¬†– The capital & busiest city of Japan.

LINKS OF TOKYO ITINERARY

We booked using AirBNB. Why? AirBNB is very popular for accommodation in Japan. It’s way cheaper and convenient than staying at those expensive Hotels. Worrying about security?¬†Just make sure to research a lot on the host, the location, the apartment and the feedbacks & reviews from the previous tenants. There’s also a super host feature where the host is rated high and is popular.

We booked accommodation with Keiko¬†–¬†AirBNB Link
Price: 2x nights for 2 persons (currency convertion was made during the time we made the reservation)
PHP ¬†3,600 x 2 nights = 7,200 PHP
or USD 76.63 x 2 nights = 153.26 USD
or YEN ¬†9,758 x 2 nights = 19, 516 YEN
Location: Nishihara, Shibuya, Tokyo Japan
Check-in 3 pm and¬†Check-out 10 am
Facitilies:¬†Hot Shower
Portable¬†wifi – I suggest to look for an apartment where they provide portable wifi so you can use it wherever you go. It’s very convenient so you won’t have to worry how to go to places. This made our stay a lot better and all our trips went smooth.
Washing machine
Fridge
A/C
Stove – We didn’t use. I suggest just have a meal at restaurants to experience local food better.
Getting there:¬†We took subway from Shinjuku¬†station¬†and was walking distance from the nearest station (about 10min walk)

Apartment was tidy & clean. Beds were comfortable and has thick blankets.

 

Osaka

It is the capital city of Osaka Prefecture and the largest component of the¬†Keihanshin Metropolitan Area, the second largest metropolitan area in Japan and among the largest in the world with over 19 million inhabitants – wikipedia.com

Things to do in Osaka…

We booked accommodation with Momo –¬†AirBNB Link
Price: 4x nights for 2 persons (currency convertion was made during the time we made the reservation)
PHP ¬†8, 967
USD ¬†190.80
YEN ¬†19, 516
Location: Nipponbashinishi, Osaka shi, Osaka Japan
Check-in 3 pm and¬†Check-out 10 am
Facitilies:¬†Hot Shower
Indoor wifi – my bad for not reading this one. I thought wifi was also portable just what we had with our apartment in Tokyo. So I made sure I searched all the places on my itinerary on the day otherwise I need to look for a free wifi spot.
Washing machine
Fridge
A/C
Small balcony
Getting there:¬†We took subway from Osaka Shi station and made one transfer (no direct line going to the apartment nearest station)
Apartment is close to Denden town, Namba & Osaka Shinsekai

Apartment was tidy & clean. Beds were comfortable and has thick blankets. We turned on A/C at night time because we need to close the window since it was near the train line and we can heart the train’s noise.

There’s one problem during our stay, using hot shower only takes several minutes before it becomes cold then we need to wait for it to be hot again. It was a bit annoying. We told the host about the issue but was not resolved during our stay. But overall it was a good place to stay.

image.alt: Where to stay in Japan – Tokyo, Osaka, Kyoto, Fukuoka

title: Itinerary in Kyoto – Golden Temple, Bamboo Forest, Fushimi Inari Shrine
excerpt: Before heading to Kyoto, I was feeling hungry and went to the street mall close to our accommodation.
content:
Before heading to Kyoto, I was feeling hungry and went to the street mall close to our accommodation. But unfortunately, all of the restos were still closed. This was the first one to open and I remember the other day when I passed this one, it has a lot of people waiting outside so I grabbed the opportunity to go here since it just opened and no any waiting lines yet.

They are a tempura resto. They prepare and cook the food in front of you so it’s still hot and crispy and you eat it.

I got a tempura set. First, they gave me a bowl of rice an egg, tempura sauce and miso soup first. They instructed me to poke the yolk and mix it with the rice. Sooo yum!

They give the tempura one by one as soon as it gets cooked. I went to Kyoto the next day.. to read visit …

After eating, I’m on my way to explore Kyoto.. First stop is Kyoto Station.

I always try to check first if there is a JR train going to my destination since I have a JR pass during this tour.

On my way to Bamboo forest Kyoto..

Getting to the bamboo forest is easy. Just follow instructions starting from the train station and you are on your way..

On my way to my next destination..

My next destination is the Golden Temple in Kyoto. You have to ride a bus going there and will take you around 1 hour bus drive (includes stop over)

View on the way to the Golden Temple

From the entrance to the Golden Template itself only takes few minutes of walk.. just follow the instructions (again)

After visiting Golden Temple, I went right away to my next stop because I need to maximize my time for the day..

Next stop, Fushimi Inari Shrine..

Soo.. That ends my day in Kyoto. I went back to Osaka after this to get rest and go out again at night..

Things¬†to do in Osaka, Japan
